Package slitherio.gameobjects

Class Snake

java.lang.Object
slitherio.gameobjects.Snake
public final class Snake extends Object
Represents a snake.

  • Field Details

    • body

      private final javafx.beans.property.ListProperty<Segment> body
      Defines the snake's body. It's a list of Segment.
      See Also:
      • ListProperty
      • SimpleListProperty

    • skin

      private String skin
      The snake's skin. It's a name of a file in the resources directory.

  • Constructor Details

    • Snake

      public Snake(String skin, double headX, double headY)
      Create a new instance of Snake. The snake has, by default, a head. The constructor initializes the snake's head with the coordinates (headX, headY).
      Parameters:
      skin - the snake's skin
      headX - X-coordinate of the snake's head
      headY - Y-coordinate of the snake's head

  • Method Details

    • move

      public final void move(double dt)
      Make the snake move in the head's direction.
      Parameters:
      dt - the elapsed time
      See Also:
      • moveToDirection(double, double)

    • moveToDirection

      private void moveToDirection(double dt, double angle)
      Make the snake move in the specified direction. The direction is calculated using an angle.
      Parameters:
      dt - the elapsed time
      angle - angle, measured in degrees.
      See Also:
      • GameObject.getAngleProperty()
      • GameObject.getDx()
      • GameObject.getDy()

      Add a Segment to the snake.

    • collides

      public final boolean collides(Snake snake)
      Return true if this snake's head collides [snake]. If this snake and [snake] are equals, return false.
      Parameters:
      snake -
      Returns:
      true if this snake's head collides [snake].

    • collides

      public final boolean collides(double maxX, double maxY)
      Return true if the snake collides the rectangle delimited by the coordinates (0,0) and (maxX,maxY). In other words, return true if the snake's head is neither strictly in nor strictly out of bounds delimited by coordinates (0,0) and (maxX,maxY).
      Parameters:
      maxX - limit of the X-coordinate
      maxY - limit of the Y-coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the snake collides the rectangle delimited by the coordinates (0,0) and (maxX,maxY)

    • byPassCollidesWindow

      public final void byPassCollidesWindow(double maxX, double maxY)
      If the snake's head collides the rectangle delimited by (0,0) and (maxX, maxY), moves the snake to the opposite edge, to give the illusion that the snake crosses the edge of the rectangle and reappears on the other edge. The rectangle is supposed
      Parameters:
      maxX - limit of X-coordinate
      maxY - limit of Y-coordinate
      See Also:
      • classic snake game rules

    • setValidPosition

      public final void setValidPosition(double maxX, double maxY)
      Put the snake in a valid coordinate in the rectangle delimited by (0,0) and (maxX, maxY) coordinates. The snake's body supposed to has juste a head.
      Parameters:
      maxX - limit of the X-coordinate
      maxY - limit of the Y-coordinate
